conclusion: Analyze the flow from point A.
Liquid flows downwards from point A and encounters the green baffle slanted downwards to the right.
Liquid will flow along the green baffle to the right and fall from its end.
It appears to fall onto the yellow baffle slanted downwards to the left.
Liquid flows along the yellow baffle to the left and falls from its end.
It appears to fall onto the purple baffle slanted downwards to the right.
Liquid flows along the purple baffle to the right and falls into the collection area.
Since the purple baffle directs the flow to the right, the liquid from A will flow into container E.
Analyze the flow from point B.
Liquid flows downwards from point B and encounters the orange baffle slanted downwards to the right.
Liquid will flow along the orange baffle to the right and fall from its end.
It appears to fall onto the white baffle slanted downwards to the left.
Liquid flows along the white baffle to the left and falls from its end.
It appears to fall onto the purple baffle slanted downwards to the right.
Liquid flows along the purple baffle to the right and falls into the collection area.
Since the purple baffle directs the flow to the right, the liquid from B will flow into container E.
Analyze the flow from point C.
Liquid flows downwards from point C with no baffle directly below to deflect the flow initially.
C is located to the right of all the upper baffles, so the liquid will fall directly downwards.
C is positioned above the area leading to container E.
The liquid from C will flow into container E.
Conclude the destination for all liquid.
Since the liquid from A, B, and C all lead to container E, the liquid will flow into container E.
